intro: Zapoteca balsasensis, commonly known as the Balsas zapoteca, is a species of flowering plant native to the highlands of southern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
